Comment: Possessors can be preposed or postposed, and expressed with enclitic or not; and this is influenced by the alienability of the relationship, as well as other factors

Comment: recipients are expressed in PP or marginally as bare NP preceding the direct object.
Verbs starting with /h/ take subject marking, vowel initial verbs never take subject marking, and consonant-initial verbs besides /h/ take only 1sg subject marking.
reflexive is expressed by an adverb (án)
reciprocal is expressed with circumfix hak- -k and with the word malu each other'
ní
e.g. lalika 'need not'
aspectual adverbs ti'an 'already', kedan 'immediately' are not verbal
some noun incorporation exists but it is rare
ditransitives are rare overall, and the verb fó'give' is the only one with two bare object NPs. The other verbs 'sell' and 'offer betel' introduce the recipient in  a PP with bá 'to'.
A rare patter of  SOV order exists in a negative and interrogative sentences. It is analysed as object incorporation
the auxiliary negative verb keta 'do not' expresses prohibitives. It precedes the main verb.
ha'i 'negator for nominal and verbal predicates', la/ lale 'negator for only verbal predicates'
Verbs of 'reported order' to call, to order, to tell: object of matrix verb is coreferent with subject of embedded verb.
Verbs of 'reported order' to call, to order, to tell: object of matrix verb is coreferent with subject of embedded verb.
no morphological distinction
the verb hakara 'wish, want' is used to express desire
